intro_text: p_l thinks r_c is, well, really, just - uh, just swell, and {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/think/thinks} r_c might like {PRONOUN/p_l/object} too. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP}{VERB/p_l/'ve/'s} been building up {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} confidence, and {PRONOUN/p_l/subject}{VERB/p_l/'re/'s} going to ask r_c to spend some time together, just the two of them, this afternoon!
decline_text: Unfortunately, r_c is sent on an afternoon border patrol before p_l can say anything.

success_outcomes.text: r_c agrees to the walk, tail-tip twitching with excitement. It's a feeling p_l openly mirrors, ears forward, pelt prickling with anxiety in the best way as they pad through the forest together. The two stop under a great oak and curl up in the piles of bright leaves beneath it.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat took a romantic stroll in the colorful leaf-fall forest together.

success_outcomes.text: All of p_l's bravery is rewarded when r_c says yes! The pair head out for their romantic stroll, the bright crunch of leaves underfoot a pleasant backdrop as they chat, heads bent together.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat took a romantic stroll in the colorful leaf-fall forest together.

success_outcomes.text: s_c has always had a skilled tongue, but it's rarely ever felt this important to choose {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} words carefully. It's all worth it to hear r_c's 'yes.' Their stroll together is awkward with the new tension of acknowledged romance, but neither cat would change it for the world.

log.cats_from: s_c's social adeptness made {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} romantic leaf-fall stroll with r_c all the better.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l awkwardly stutters {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} way through asking r_c out - and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/say/says} no. It's gentle, but it's a no. Tail tucked, p_l slinks off to be alone.

log.cats_from: p_l felt embarrassed when r_c rejected {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} offer of a romantic stroll.
r_c felt awkward when p_l asked {PRONOUN/r_c/object} out on a romantic stroll, and r_c rejected the offer.

intro_text: The leaves drift high in sunset piles beneath the shedding trees, and as the patrol wanders the familiar forest paths, app1 gets swallowed up.
decline_text: app1 reappears soon enough, a bright red leaf plastered to {PRONOUN/app1/poss} forehead.

success_outcomes.text: app1 explodes out of the leaf drift, bowling over app2! Laughing, p_l bats at r_c, claws sheathed, and skids off the path into the leaves as the patrol devolves into rustling, raucous, riotous fun.

fail_outcomes.text: app1? app1?! It takes a good while to recover the apprentice from the far-deeper-than-expected leaf drift. No one is hurt, but it certainly derails the training they were intending on doing.

intro_text: The leaves drift high in sunset piles beneath the shedding trees, and as the patrol wanders the familiar forest paths, app1 gets swallowed up.
decline_text: app1 reappears soon enough, a bright red leaf plastered to {PRONOUN/app1/poss} forehead.

success_outcomes.text: app1 leaps out of the leaf drift, sending p_l falling into r_c as {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/fly/flies} by to bowl app2 into yet more leaves. The two apprentices descend into furious mock combat, yowling with excitement, as r_c gazes up at p_l in bewilderment.

fail_outcomes.text: app1? app1?! It takes a good while to recover the apprentice from the far-deeper-than-expected leaf drift. No one is hurt, but it certainly derails the training they were intending on doing.

intro_text: The leaves drift high in sunset piles beneath the shedding trees, and as the patrol wanders the familiar forest paths, app1 gets swallowed up.
decline_text: app1 reappears soon enough, a bright red leaf plastered to {PRONOUN/app1/poss} forehead.

success_outcomes.text: app1 leaps out of the leaf drift, bowling app2 head over paws and batting at {PRONOUN/app2/subject} furiously. p_l and r_c share a long, exasperated look, rolling their eyes as the apprentices flicker between yelling insults and flirting while they spar. p_l's sure the apprentices think they're very subtle.

fail_outcomes.text: app1? app1?! It takes a good while to recover the apprentice from the far-deeper-than-expected leaf drift. No one is hurt, but it certainly derails the training they were intending on doing.

intro_text: Gather round, gather round. p_l sits in the center of the group, in the most prominent place, and drops {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} voice down low as a hush falls - today, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject}'ll tell the story of StarClan's Great Anger.
decline_text: A leaf-fall rainshower chooses that moment to break - thematic, perhaps, but wet. The cats decide to pick up the story some other time.

success_outcomes.text: At first, few but the medicine cats noticed the leaf-fall, its harshness, the snows early, the prey scarce. All noticed on the day StarClan hissed - the great sun itself blinking dark under their anger. All paid heed to the omens then, and the Clans turned back to the Stars, begging for life and sun to return. They learned a lesson not soon forgotten.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c refuses to believe their ancestors ever blotted out the sun - not that they couldn't, but that they wouldn't ever hurt the Clans, their own beloved descendants.
If StarClan hissed at them, they should've hissed back, s_c argues. Their ancestors are nothing without them!
